unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Linear Transformation of Variables
question_text: The random variable $X$ is skewed left with a median of $10$ and IQR of $40$. The random variable $Y$ is defined by $Y=3X-7$. What are the median and IQR of $Y$?

choices.text: The median is $23$ and the IQR is $33$.
The median is $23$ and the IQR is $113$.
The median is $23$ and the IQR is $120$.
The median is $30$ and the IQR is $113$.
The median is $30$ and the IQR is $120$.

solution:
We are dealing with a linear transformation.

Since the median is measure of center, the new median will be:

$$3X-7$$

$$=(3)(10)-7$$

$$=23$$

Since the IQR is a measure of spread, the new IQR will be:

$$3X$$

$$=(3)(40)$$

$$=120$$

Explanation of Distractors

Choice ‘A’ is incorrect as the IQR gets affected by multiplication and not subtraction.

Choice ‘B’ is incorrect as the IQR will not get subtracted by $7$.

Choice ‘D’ is incorrect as the median will get subtracted by $7$, but the IQR will not.

Choice ‘E’ is incorrect as the median will get subtracted by $7$.
